tool_description: The API provides endpoints to generate challenges, validate signature and certificate chains (PKI).
name: EU-LOTL Certificate Validation
title: EU-LOTL Certificate Validation

api_list.name: Validate Certificate Chain
api_list.description: This endpoint validates a Certificate chain and performs an OCSP/CRL check. The first certificate must be the leaf certificate, followed by one or more intermediate certificates. The last certificate in the chain must be the root issuer. The leaf certificate should start with order '0'. Certificates should be base64 encoded strings.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://trust1team-eu-lotl-certificate-validation-v1.p.rapidapi.com/certs/validate-chain"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "trust1team-eu-lotl-certificate-validation-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Validate Signed Challenge
api_list.description: This endpoint validates a signed challenge (for example 'strong authentication'). The challenge must be generated with a GET request on '/challenge'.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://trust1team-eu-lotl-certificate-validation-v1.p.rapidapi.com/challenge"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "trust1team-eu-lotl-certificate-validation-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Validate Signature by Certificate
api_list.description: This endpoint validates signatures. The digest algorithm can be: 'MD5', 'SHA1', 'SHA256' or 'SHA512'. Default SHA1 is used.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://trust1team-eu-lotl-certificate-validation-v1.p.rapidapi.com/signature/validate"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "trust1team-eu-lotl-certificate-validation-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
